We will continue to fight for $2,000 monthly checks.

We will continue to fight for a full cancellation of rent and mortgage payments during the pandemic. 

I’m ready to keep working to get families through this pandemic and thrive for years to come.
An immediate next priority for Congress and the White House must be a nationwide $15 minimum wage. The Biden administration was given a mandate by voters to secure a $15 minimum. They must deliver.

The #AmericanRescuePlan provides $1,400 payments to many who are in need. But families should never be without our support. That means we’ll keep pushing for $2,000 recurring checks for the duration of the pandemic, and a strengthened social safety net thereafter.
Our kids and families have dealt with unbelievable trauma during this pandemic, and I’m optimistic that this package will help us to heal. But there are many ways we can still go even further.

Importantly, the rescue plan drastically reduces poverty, particularly among people of color, and provides $170 billion in resources for education to assist with a smooth and safe reopening of in-person learning across the country.
The #AmericanRescuePlan, although not perfect, is a significant and profound step to rebuild what we've lost during this pandemic, move toward making families whole, and save lives.

No matter the presidential administration, Congress must embrace and retain their role and duty as a body tasked with oversight. As Republicans, we are committed to holding @POTUS accountable for decisions that affect American taxpayers. #MakeItREINS /4

In this bill, a major rule is defined as a federal rule or regulation that will have an annual economic effect of $100M or more. It would also give Congress oversight of federal rules that affect American companies' ability to compete with foreign entities. #MakeItREINS 3/

The REINS Act would require every new major rule passed by the executive bureaucracy to be approved by both houses of Congress. For too long, the executive branch has ignored Congress' right to executive oversight. #MakeItREINS 2/

Today, I am proud to introduce the 2021 REINS Act—Regulations from the Executive In Need of Scrutiny. Michiganders have been hit hard by this crisis, and the COVID relief bill we passed today will begin to make a difference for people across my district almost immediately. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EwJjTKYXcAwcl_h.jpg

This bill will put our region and our country on track to defeat this horrible virus, reopen schools, get people back to work and rebuild our economy. I was proud to vote for it today and will never stop working to make sure North Texas has the resources we need to recover.

7️⃣ The American Rescue Plan includes nearly $130 billion to give K-12 schools the resources they need to reopen safely. These funds will help repair ventilation systems, purchase PPE, and implement social distancing guidelines, with 20% dedicated to address loss of learning.

6️⃣ This package also addresses the disparities in access to health care that this pandemic has laid bare. It adds incentives for states like Texas that have failed to expand Medicaid and makes coverage affordable for middle class families who were previously priced out.

5️⃣ The most important thing we can do for our economy and our families is to increase vaccine distribution. The American Rescue Plan will create a national plan, including community vaccine centers and aid for state and local governments to help support their operations.

4️⃣ Aviation is a key component of our economy here in North Texas. This bill will continue to provide stability for airline workers by adding an additional $15 billion to the Payroll Support Program. It also includes funding to support @DFWAirport and @DallasLoveField.

3️⃣ The American Rescue Plan ensures our hardest hit businesses have the resources they need to weather this crisis and recover by establishing a Restaurant Revitalization Fund and giving PPP priority to our smallest businesses.
2️⃣ It expands the Child Tax Credit by $1,000 dollars for kids over 6 & $1,600 for kids under 6. This could lift 500,000 Texas kids out of poverty.
1️⃣ This bill includes additional direct payments of up to $1,400 per adult & kid, so a family of four could get up to $5,600.

Myth: Massive, top-down policies are the only way to enact change.

Fact: Often the simplest polices are the most effective. Using free-market principles that incentivize creative solutions, we can make progress today without radically changing life as we know it.

Myth: Democrats have led the way on environmental reform. 

Fact: Conservatives were actually the original trailblazers in this field- look no further than Teddy Roosevelt, the Father of Conservation- and we will continue to lead on these issues.

Myth: Conservatives only care about the economy.

Fact: We reject the notion you have to choose between the economy & environment. A healthy economy should result in a healthy environment, & vice versa. Unlike Dems, we want to incentivize innovative environmental solutions.

Myth: Conservation is just about preserving our resources.

Fact: Conservation means managing our resources well so they last for generations to come. This includes using them responsibly and sustainably, not just shutting them up forever and restricting access and development.
There are countless misconceptions when it comes to conservation, so let’s dive in ↓

Welcome back to #WomensHistoryWednesday!
